# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution using Julia language. It uses the Dates package to manipulate DateTimes and DataFrames to work with data frames.

```julia
using Dates, DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[Symbol("ym")] = (Year.(df[:dt]) .* 100 .+ Month.(df[:dt]))
end
```

This function takes a dataframe `df` as input and adds a new column named `ym`. The values in this column are formed by multiplying the Year part of each DateTime in `dt` by 100 (to shift it to the left, i.e., from year to yy) and adding the Month part to it.
